intro: Glossocalyx staudtii, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, hairy foliage and showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Glossocalyx staudtii is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
